title: Roasted-beet Salad With Blue Cheese
summary: Roasted-beet Salad With Blue Cheese might be just the side dish you are searching for. One portion of this dish contains approximately 5g of protein, 13g of fat, and a total of 199 calories. This recipe serves 12. For 85 cents per serving, this recipe covers 10% of your daily requirements of vitamins and minerals. From preparation to the plate, this recipe takes roughly 1 hour and 9 minutes. This recipe from Martha Stewart has 20 fans. It is a good option if you're following a gluten free, primal, and vegetarian diet. If you have olive oil, pecans, coarse salt and pepper, and a few other ingredients on hand, you can make it. With a spoonacular score of 71%, this dish is pretty good. Try Roasted Beet Salad with Blue Cheese and Nuts, Red Lettuce and Roasted Beet Salad with Walnuts and Blue Cheese, and Warm Roasted Beet Salad With Spinach and Blue Cheese for similar recipes.
instructions: Preheat oven to 400 degrees. Line 4 pieces of foil with parchment. Place 10 beets in center of each; drizzle with oil. Season with salt and pepper. Fold into packets, crimping edges to seal. Place on a baking sheet, and roast until beets are tender, about 1 hour. Unfold packets to cool slightly. Peel, and quarter.

steps.step: Preheat oven to 400 degrees. Line 4 pieces of foil with parchment.
Place 10 beets in center of each; drizzle with oil. Season with salt and pepper. Fold into packets, crimping edges to seal.
Place on a baking sheet, and roast until beets are tender, about 1 hour. Unfold packets to cool slightly. Peel, and quarter.
